stem: A patient with vasculitic mononeuritis multiplex has right hand weakness. If the radial nerve is affected in the radial groove, which finding is expected?

choices.A: Loss of wrist and finger extension with preserved elbow extension
choices.D: Inability to flex the distal interphalangeal joint of the index finger
choices.E: Loss of sensation over the medial forearm

rationale_correct: Radial groove lesions spare the triceps but denervate wrist and finger extensors, producing wrist drop and finger extension weakness.

rationale_distractors.B: Elbow extension loss implies triceps involvement from a more proximal lesion.
rationale_distractors.C: Thenar atrophy is a median (recurrent motor) finding.
rationale_distractors.D: DIP flexion of the index finger is AIN (median) mediated.
rationale_distractors.E: Medial forearm cutaneous sensation is from the medial antebrachial cutaneous nerve (brachial plexus medial cord).
